title: Bookmarks do not appear
content:
With the latest firefox update all my bookmarks do not appear on my windows11 desktop. But the synchronized booksmarks on my win10 note book and on my iphone still exist. So nothing is lost, the bookmarks simply do not show up on the win11 desktop. With this firefox update I also received a desktop message that bookmarks might not appear because of an interference with the internet security program (f-secure) Unfortunately I did not give enough attention to this explaination there and the steps how to solve the problem.

Can somebody send me the link to this explaination or tell me how to fix the bookmark interference with f-secure?

many thanks thomas

title: choosing bookmark location no longer an option
content:
When I choose to bookmark a website, I am no longer offered a chance to save to where I want it saved.

FF 146.0.1. Windows 10 pro

So, now I have to bookmark a page, and open the bookmark menu again to EDIT the bookmark to move it. This is Horrible. I have to do this eachj time I bookmark a page. I am veriy organized and have dozens of bookmark folder, some with folders within folders... etc.

Onliy children need to be treated this way.

I have searched the settings and find nothing. I am not using any add-on that has anything to do with bookmark. I do not use the bookmark toolbars or other bookmark interfaces. Just the file/edit... menu "bookmarks" option.,

Has this ability been removed?

title: Firefox exits full screen when autoplay is enabled on a streaming website.
content: I am on Windows 11. Asus laptop PC. On Google Chrome, any streaming website I used with autoplay enabled would KEEP full screen mode ON after changing episodes. It would automatically go to a new page with the following episode and remain full screen. Why doesn't Firefox have this feature?? I'm seriously considering going back to Google Chrome for this one small feature. Every time I had any streaming service playing with autoplay enabled, I didn't have to manually select the full screen option every time. I am having to stand up and manually click full screen function. Every. Single. Time. This needs to change PLEASE.
creator: houstontx7134

title: Restore tabs on a new computer after the old one died
content:
My computer died when I had many tabs open. Some of them were important. I cannot get back into my old computer to recover them from there. It appears that sync was not enabled. Is there any way I can get them on my new computer?

I can actually see a list of the tabs. When I hit the hamburger icon, the first item is my account. At the bottom of my account is a heading “[username] on [device name]”. Underneath is a list of all my tabs from my last computer.

But I have to open them one by one. Is there any way to batch open these pages?
creator: rbfoster7

title: Firefox's security sandbox

I'm running Firefox v146.0.1

title: I have updated wrong password
content: Hello, unfortunately I have updated wrong password. I was visiting a site and it forced me to change password. So I let Mozilla auto-generate one and clicked update. The password however didn't match their requirements. So now I am stuck with Mozilla that has updated password in its and the site that requires the old one. Luckily I can see that there is file called "logins-backup.json" in my AppData directory. I have no idea how to access it and restore it though. I tried copying or renaming the file, but windows keep saying I don't have permissions to do that(even though I am owner of the file). Is there any way to restore the old password? Thank you.
creator: vavra.pepa
